Breast Cancer.question: Who can get a free mammogram?
answers: Those with symptoms of breast cancer
Those who had a mammogram in the last 12 months
Those who are pregnant or breastfeeding
Breast Cancer.response: Those aged 45-69 can get a free mammogram! Did you know you can still get screened even if you feel well?

Breast Cancer.question: At what age can wahine start getting a free mammogram in NZ?
Breast Cancer.response: They can start getting a free mammogram from 45! Did you know you can still get screened even if you feel well?

Breast Cancer.question: How often can you do a free mammogram?
Breast Cancer.response: You can get your free mammogram every 2 years. Did you know you can still get screened even if you feel well?

Breast Cancer.question: Where can you find a BreastScreen clinic?
Breast Cancer.response: With BreastScreen clinics all across the country, including several mobile clinics throughout the year, there's sure to be one near you!

Breast Cancer.question: Where can you get a mammogram in New Zealand?
Breast Cancer.response: Mammograms are available at BreastScreen clinics, and mobile units travel around different regions!

Breast Cancer.question: Which group receives extra support for breast cancer screening?
Breast Cancer.response: Extra support is provided to Māori and Pacific women aged 45-69! Support also available to those aged 45-69 who've never been screened.

Cervical Cancer.question: Where can you get your cervical screen done?
answers: Your usual doctor or nurse at a GP clinic
Māori, Pacific or women’s community health centres
Cervical Cancer.response: You can get screened at your usual doctor or nurse or Māori, Pacific, women's community health centre, or even do a self-test!

Cervical Cancer.question: What option is available for cervical screening if you prefer privacy?
answers: You can only get screened at a clinic
You must go to a hospital
You get a referral from a specialist
Cervical Cancer.response: You can even request to do a self-test for cervical screening, allowing for greater privacy and convenience!

Cervical Cancer.question: Who can get a free cervical test?
answers: Māori and Pacific women aged 25 to 69
Women aged 25 to 69 with a community services card
Women over the age of 30 who have never been screened or not screened within 5 years
Cervical Cancer.response: All of those groups can get a test done! Did you know you can still get screened even if you feel healthy?

Cervical Cancer.question: At what age can wahine start getting a free cervical screening test in NZ?
Cervical Cancer.response: Wahine in New Zealand can start getting free cervical screening tests at age 25! Did you know you can still get screened even if you feel healthy?

Cervical Cancer.question: Which group receives extra support for cervical cancer screening?
Cervical Cancer.response: Extra support is available for Māori and Pacific wahine aged 25-69 to encourage cervical screening!

Bowel Cancer.question: Where can you do your bowel screening test?
Bowel Cancer.response: You can do the bowel screening test at the comfort of your own home, and it is easy to do!

Bowel Cancer.question: How will you receive your bowel screening test kit?
answers: Pick it up at a pharmacy
Delivered to your home by mail
Get it at a health clinic
Bowel Cancer.correctAnswer: Delivered to your home by mail
Bowel Cancer.response: Your bowel screening test kit will be mailed to your home every 2 years if you are aged 60-74. Call 0800 924 432 if you haven't received yours!

Bowel Cancer.question: How often will you receive your bowel screening test kit?
Bowel Cancer.response: You will receive your kit every 2 years! Screening regularly is important as it can look out for very early signs of cancer!

Bowel Cancer.question: Who can get a free bowel screening test kit?
Bowel Cancer.response: Anyone aged 60-74 can get a free test kit. Did you know you can still get screened even if you feel well?

Bowel Cancer.question: At what age will you start getting a free test kit?
Bowel Cancer.response: You will start getting your free test kit sent to you from when you are 60! Call 0800 924 432 if you haven't received yours!

Bowel Cancer.question: Until what age can you receive free bowel screening?
Bowel Cancer.response: You can receive free bowel screening up until you are 74! Screening is important even if you feel healthy

Bowel Cancer.question: Which group receives extra support for bowel cancer screening?
answers: Māori and Pacific people who have not completed a test
All people who live in rural areas
Bowel Cancer.correctAnswer: Māori and Pacific people who have not completed a test
Bowel Cancer.response: Māori and Pacific people who have not completed a test can receive extra support through the screening stages!
